Content-Type: text/plain; charset=ISO-8859-1
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi,

I am using Heritrix 1.14.3 within NetArchive Suite 3.10. At BnF we are=

currently running production tests for broad crawls on the french domains.=


I will quickly summarize how NetArchive Suite 'pilots" Heritrix. NetArchi=
ve
creates one instance of Heritrix for a given job, and sends a shutdown
c=
ommand to Heritrix once the said job is reported as completed (through the
=
JMX method "completedJobs" on the CrawlServer MBean) or the  job status (JM=
X
command "Status" on the CrawlJob MBean) is either null (can this really
h=
appen?), finished or illegal.

The Heritrix reports are then archived in a =
special metadata archive. What
we experience is a lot of such reports missi=
ng, such a host-report.txt.
These reports are compiled from the crawl log I=
 believe, but does this
happen before or after the job is reported as compl=
eted?

Is there a way to interrogate Heritrix on the completion of report
g=
eneration? Then I could add some kind of watchdog to the code. Currently my=

only option would be to wait an additional time (based on experience, but
=
still possibly inaccurate) once we consider the job completed.

Thanks for =
your help.

-- 
Nicolas Giraud
--------------------------------------------=
-------------------------------------------------
D=E9veloppeur Archives du=
 Web - Biblioth=E8que Nationale de France
Web Archiving Developper - Nation=
al Library of France
------------------------------------------------------=
---------------------------------------

--0016364267f5893483048160a53a

Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

Hi,<br><br>I am using Heritrix 1.14.3 within NetArchive Suite 3.10. At BnF =
we are currently running production tests for broad crawls on the french do=
mains.<br><br>I will quickly summarize how NetArchive Suite 'pilots&quo=
t; Heritrix. NetArchive creates one instance of Heritrix for a given job, a=
nd sends a shutdown command to Heritrix once the said job is reported as co=
mpleted (through the JMX method "completedJobs" on the CrawlServe=
r MBean) or the=A0 job status (JMX command "Status" on the CrawlJ=
ob MBean) is either null (can this really happen?), finished or illegal.<br=
>
<br>The Heritrix reports are then archived in a special metadata archive.=
 What we experience is a lot of such reports missing, such a host-report.tx=
t. These reports are compiled from the crawl log I believe, but does this h=
appen before or after the job is reported as completed? <br>
<br>Is there a=
 way to interrogate Heritrix on the completion of report generation? Then I=
 could add some kind of watchdog to the code. Currently my only option woul=
d be to wait an additional time (based on experience, but still possibly in=
accurate) once we consider the job completed.<br>
<br>Thanks for your help.=
